list_definition.definition: to be in, come into, or make, contact with something else

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He touched the water with his foot.

list_definition.definition: to affect the feelings of; to make (someone) feel pity, sympathy etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I was touched by her generosity.

list_definition.definition: to be concerned with; to have anything to do with

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I wouldn’t touch a job like that.

list_definition.definition: an act or sensation of touching

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I felt a touch on my shoulder.

list_definition.definition: (often with the) one of the five senses, the sense by which we feel things

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The stone felt cold to the touch.

list_definition.definition: a mark or stroke etc to improve the appearance of something

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The painting still needs a few finishing touches.
He hasn’t lost his touch as a writer.

list_definition.definition: (in football) the ground outside the edges of the pitch (which are marked out with touchlines)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He kicked the ball into touch.
